tests.title: Test 1 - Basic to Intermediate
tests.cognitiveLevel: Understanding meaning changes and particle placement

transformations.sentence1: The teacher distributed the exam papers to all students.
transformations.sentence2: The teacher _____ the exam papers to all students.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Must recognize 'distributed' = 'gave out'

transformations.sentence1: My older sister looks just like my grandmother.
transformations.sentence2: My older sister _____ my grandmother.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'wait for a moment' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The car stopped functioning on the motorway during the storm.
transformations.sentence2: The car _____ on the motorway during the storm.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'stopped functioning' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: My sister became sick with the flu last weekend.
transformations.sentence2: My sister _____ the flu last weekend.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'became sick with' to three-word phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: We returned from our holiday in Spain yesterday.
transformations.sentence2: We _____ from our holiday in Spain yesterday.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'returned' to simple phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Could you please wait for a moment while I check the information?
transformations.sentence2: Could you please _____ while I check the information?
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'wait for a moment' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I need to take care of my younger brother this evening.
transformations.sentence2: I need to _____ my younger brother this evening.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'take care of' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: We are postponing the meeting until next Friday.
transformations.sentence2: We are _____ the meeting until next Friday.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'postponing' to phrasal verb with gerund

transformations.sentence1: I tried to find her address in the telephone directory.
transformations.sentence2: I tried to _____ her address in the telephone directory.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'find' (search for information) to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The truth finally became known after many years.
transformations.sentence2: The truth finally _____ after many years.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'became known' to phrasal verb

tests.title: Test 2 - Intermediate with Structural Changes
tests.cognitiveLevel: Multiple transformations: tense, voice, and structure changes

transformations.sentence1: I must leave home now or I'll miss the train.
transformations.sentence2: I must _____ now or I'll miss the train.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'leave home' to phrasal verb, remove unnecessary words

transformations.sentence1: The couple ended their relationship after five years together.
transformations.sentence2: The couple _____ after five years together.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'ended their relationship' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I need to search for my keys before we leave.
transformations.sentence2: I need to _____ my keys before we leave.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'search for' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Could you please decrease the volume on the television?
transformations.sentence2: Could you please _____ the television?
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'decrease volume' and simplify object

transformations.sentence1: My boss organised a meeting with the clients for tomorrow.
transformations.sentence2: My boss _____ a meeting with the clients for tomorrow.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'organised' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I unexpectedly met my old teacher at the supermarket.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ my old teacher at the supermarket.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'unexpectedly met' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The students continued working despite the noise outside.
transformations.sentence2: The students _____ working despite the noise outside.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'continued' to phrasal verb with gerund

transformations.sentence1: We have finished all the milk so we need to buy more.
transformations.sentence2: We have _____ milk so we need to buy more.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'finished all' to three-word phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I invented an excuse for being late to class.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ an excuse for being late to class.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'invented' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: My daughter resembles her grandmother in appearance and character.
transformations.sentence2: My daughter _____ her grandmother in appearance and character.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'resembles' to phrasal verb

tests.title: Test 3 - Advanced with Multiple Changes
tests.cognitiveLevel: Complex: multiple grammatical changes + meaning preservation

transformations.sentence1: I am excited about my holiday to Greece next month.
transformations.sentence2: I am _____ my holiday to Greece next month.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'excited about' to three-word phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The plane will start flying at 6 AM tomorrow morning.
transformations.sentence2: The plane will _____ at 6 AM tomorrow morning.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'start flying' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I exercise at the gym four times per week.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ at the gym four times per week.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'exercise' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Please review your answers before submitting the exam.
transformations.sentence2: Please _____ your answers before submitting the exam.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'review' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: We will collect you from the airport when you arrive.
transformations.sentence2: We will _____ you from the airport when you arrive.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'collect' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: My grandmother has stopped smoking after forty years.
transformations.sentence2: My grandmother has _____ smoking after forty years.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'stopped' to phrasal verb with present perfect

transformations.sentence1: I discovered the answer in an old textbook.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ the answer in an old textbook.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'discovered' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The investigation was completed by a team of experts.
transformations.sentence2: The investigation was _____ by a team of experts.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform passive 'was completed' to passive phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Several interesting topics were mentioned during the discussion.
transformations.sentence2: Several interesting topics _____ during the discussion.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform passive 'were mentioned' to active phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: My father decided to stop working and relax after retirement.
transformations.sentence2: My father decided to _____ and relax after retirement.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'stop working' with physical action implied

tests.title: Test 4 - Mixed Challenges with Distractors
tests.cognitiveLevel: Requires rejecting obvious but incorrect options

transformations.sentence1: I reluctantly stopped arguing and accepted his suggestion.
transformations.sentence2: I reluctantly _____ and accepted his suggestion.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'stopped arguing and accepted' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I got out of bed at seven o'clock this morning.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ at seven o'clock this morning.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'got out of bed' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The elderly woman fainted because of the heat.
transformations.sentence2: The elderly woman _____ because of the heat.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'fainted' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Please switch off the lights when you leave the room.
transformations.sentence2: Please _____ the lights when you leave the room.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'switch off' to different phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I chose the blue dress for the wedding.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ the blue dress for the wedding.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'chose' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Don't forget to wear your jacket because it's cold outside.
transformations.sentence2: Don't forget to _____ your jacket because it's cold outside.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'wear' to phrasal verb (different meaning)

transformations.sentence1: I have to tolerate my neighbour's loud music every night.
transformations.sentence2: I have to _____ my neighbour's loud music every night.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'tolerate' to three-word phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: We began our journey very early in the morning.
transformations.sentence2: We _____ very early in the morning.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'began our journey' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: After arguing all day, they finally forgave each other.
transformations.sentence2: After arguing all day, they finally _____.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'forgave each other' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: It finally happened that he was telling the truth all along.
transformations.sentence2: It _____ that he was telling the truth all along.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'finally happened' to phrasal verb

tests.title: Test 5 - Expert Level Mixed Skills
tests.cognitiveLevel: Maximum complexity: passive voice, reported speech, multiple changes

transformations.sentence1: She indicated with her finger where the restaurant was located.
transformations.sentence2: She _____ where the restaurant was located.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'indicated with finger' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: I agree with your opinion about the new policy.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ your opinion about the new policy.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'agree with' to three-word phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The batteries have finished and the device stopped working.
transformations.sentence2: The batteries have finished and the device _____.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'stopped working' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: When I think about the past, I remember many happy moments.
transformations.sentence2: When I _____, I remember many happy moments.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'think about the past' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The company was purchased by a larger competitor last year.
transformations.sentence2: The company was _____ by a larger competitor last year.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform passive 'was purchased' to passive phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: All our savings were consumed during the holiday.
transformations.sentence2: All our savings were _____ during the holiday.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform passive 'were consumed' to passive phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: We boarded the bus just before it departed.
transformations.sentence2: We _____ the bus just before it departed.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'boarded' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The manager prevented the employee from making a serious mistake.
transformations.sentence2: The manager _____ the employee from making a serious mistake.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'prevented from' to phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: The numbers in your bill equal exactly one hundred pounds.
transformations.sentence2: The numbers in your bill _____ exactly one hundred pounds.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'equal' to three-word phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: You need to reverse your vehicle to let the truck pass.
transformations.sentence2: You need to _____ your vehicle to let the truck pass.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'reverse' to phrasal verb

criticalThinkingSkills: Students must analyze the entire sentence structure, not just vocabulary
Multiple grammatical changes often required (tense, voice, word order)
Distractors force students to think about precise meanings of phrasal verbs
Context clues are essential - the 'obvious' answer may be wrong
Particle placement and separability must be considered
commonMistakes: Choosing a phrasal verb with the right verb but wrong particle
Forgetting to change tenses when transforming the sentence
Not recognizing when passive voice is needed
Missing that negative structures need different phrasal verbs
Ignoring that some transformations require adverb movement
assessmentGuidelines: Award full marks only for exact correct answer
Alternative answers must be equally valid in all contexts
Minor spelling errors may be overlooked if meaning is clear
Particle placement variations acceptable only where both are correct
Case insensitivity for answers (though keywords must be uppercase)
